oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Wool blanket with red end stripe of Richard Houston Palmer
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: White wool blanket with red end stripe carried in the war by Richard Houston Palmer, Co. D, 7th Tenn. Inf., CSA. Palmer was from north of Lebanon in Wilson County, Tenn. He survived the war and was never wounded and seemed to present and every roll call.; He was paroled on April 9, 1865 at Appomattox Court House, Virginia.
